item.title: 巴西将世界银行视为 1,250 亿美元森林基金的重要盟友
item.description: 巴西相信世界银行将成为其主要合作伙伴，共同发起一个价值 1,250 亿美元的热带森林保护基金；这是巴西在 11 月举行的 COP30 气候峰会上提出的旗舰倡议之一。【原文：Brazil is confident the World Bank will be its main partner in launching a $125 billion fund to protect tropical forests — one of the country’s flagship initiatives for the COP30 climate summit in November.】

item.title: ETF 先驱 Som Seif 因加拿大监管机构质疑 ESG 声称而反击
item.description: 一心想要颠覆加拿大金融业的企业家索姆-赛义夫（Som Seif）发现自己正处于与加拿大最高市场监管部门史无前例的对决的中心。【原文：Som Seif, the entrepreneur bent on disrupting Canada’s financial industry, has found himself at the center of an unprecedented showdown with the country’s top markets watchdog.】

item.title: 荷兰养老基金是削减以色列风险的最新投资者
item.description: 拥有 680 亿美元资产的荷兰养老基金 PME 表示，在确认所持股份可能与侵犯人权行为有关之后，该基金已经退出了对一些涉足巴勒斯坦领土的公司的投资。【原文：PME, a Dutch pension fund with $68 billion in assets, said it has exited investments in a number of companies exposed to the Palestinian territories, after identifying the holdings as potentially tied to human rights violations.】

item.title: 能源出口竞赛明显胜出：中国
item.description: 中国将自己定位为世界清洁技术出口中心，而美国，尤其是在唐纳德-特朗普总统的领导下，则将自己定位为全球加油站。这引发了一场能源出口霸主之争。这是太阳能、风能和电池与石油和天然气的较量。【原文：China has positioned itself as the world’s clean tech export hub while the US — especially under President Donald Trump — has pitched itself as a global gas station. That’s set up a battle for energy export supremacy. It’s solar, wind and batteries vs. oil and gas.】

item.title: 在夜间反射太阳光为太阳能电池板供电的计划令天文学家不满
item.description:
反射轨道公司（Reflect Orbital）的目标是在明年将计划中的 4000 颗卫星中的第一颗送入轨道。科学家们担心这将 "毁掉 "研究工作。【原文：

Reflect Orbital aims to launch its first of a planned 4,000 satellites into orbit next year. Scientists worry that it would be “ruinous” for research.

】

item.title: 法国和德国电价因寒流创七个月新高
item.description: 法国和德国的电力价格攀升至 2 月份以来的最高点，原因是预测气温会更低，而且人们担心可再生能源产量会减少。【原文：French and German power prices climbed to the highest since February on forecasts for colder temperatures and concerns about lower renewable output.】

item.title: COP30 气候峰会成败的六种方式
item.description: 两年前，巴西被指定为 COP30 气候峰会的主办国，这被视为《巴黎协定》十周年的完美庆典，各国在《巴黎协定》中承诺将气候变化控制在安全范围内。【原文：When Brazil was named host of the COP30 climate summit two years ago, it was seen as the perfect celebration of the 10th anniversary of the Paris Agreement, where nations pledged to keep climate change within safe limits.】

item.title: 日本即将上任的领导人将把核能作为能源计划的核心
item.description: 这位有望成为日本下一任首相的女性将继续把核能作为国家能源战略的核心，同时减少对太阳能等随时可用的可再生能源的重视。【原文：The woman expected to be Japan’s next prime minister is set to keep nuclear power at the core of the nation’s energy strategy, while reducing emphasis on readily available renewables like solar.】

item.title: 中国在能源出口主导权争夺战中击败美国
item.description:
中国清洁能源技术的出口额在 8 月份创下新高，全球出口额达 200 亿美元。【原文：

China’s exports of clean energy technology hit a record in August, with $20 billion shipped globally. 

】

item.title: 瞄准火灾保险的对冲基金在加州碰壁
item.description: 在加利福尼亚州通过了旨在扼杀此类赌注的新立法之后，对冲基金在加利福尼亚州投机野火保险索赔的行为遭到了法律打击。【原文：Hedge funds speculating on wildfire insurance claims in California were just dealt a legal blow, after the state adopted new legislation designed to stifle such bets.】

item.title: 黑名单上的俄罗斯飞机降落在南非，报道称
item.description: 据约翰内斯堡 Rapport 报道，一架被列入黑名单的俄罗斯货机周四载着重物降落在南非，当天晚些时候空舱离去。【原文：A blacklisted Russian cargo plane landed in South Africa with a heavy load on Thursday and departed with an empty hold later in the day, according to Johannesburg’s Rapport.】

item.title: Reddit 前首席执行官希望您为树木购买订阅服务
item.description: 黄一山因在2012年至2014年期间领导社交媒体平台Reddit而为人熟知，但自2020年起，他通过其森林恢复初创公司Terraformation将注意力转向了应对气候变化。今年夏天，该公司推出了最新的测试版产品：该产品采用订阅模式，个人只需每月支付流媒体服务的费用，即可资助植树造林。【原文：Yishan Wong is best known for leading the social media platform Reddit from 2012 to 2014, but since 2020 he has turned his attention to fighting climate change through his forest restoration startup, Terraformation. This summer, the business rolled out its latest product in beta: A subscription-based model where individuals can fund reforestation for the monthly cost of a streaming service.】

item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Britain’s clean energy sector faces supply challenges brought on by declining wind speeds, according to analysts at Citigroup Inc.】

item.description:
该倡议旨在恢复美国西海岸濒临灭绝的动物，使海洋生态系统更能适应气候变化。

。【原文：

The initiative aims to restore the imperiled animals to the US West Coast to make marine ecosystems more resilient to climate change.

】

item.title: 私人资金将帮助加州海獭恢复健康
item.description: 周五快乐我们为您带来了华盛顿特区在政府关门期间的每周简报。但首先是海獭。【原文：Happy Friday! We’ve got your weekly debrief of what went on in Washington, DC, amid the government shutdown. But first, sea otters.】

item.title: 摩根大通银行行长称人工智能繁荣令美国 "过度依赖 "核能
item.description: 在摩根大通公司的投资银行部门内部，人们担心对核能的热情可能已经过头。【原文：Inside the investment banking division of JPMorgan Chase & Co., there’s concern that enthusiasm for nuclear energy might have gone too far.】

item.title: 银行气候组织在华尔街撤离后正式解散
item.description: 全球最大的银行气候联盟周五表示，该联盟已停止运作，从而正式结束了一个四年前刚刚吸引全球许多最大贷款机构做出净零承诺的项目。【原文：The world’s biggest climate alliance for banks said on Friday it has ceased operations, bringing to a formal end a project that drew net zero pledges from many of the world’s biggest lenders just four years ago.】

item.title: 组织称西班牙发生数十年来最严重的停电事故
item.description: 一个地区电网组织表示，去年 4 月导致西班牙陷入黑暗的大停电是前所未有的事件，也是过去二十年来欧洲电网遭受的最严重的一次停电。【原文：The blackout that left Spain in the dark last April was an unprecedented event and the most severe to hit European networks in the last two decades, a regional power grids group said.】

item.title: 瑞典是新的葡萄酒王国
item.description:
在传统葡萄酒产区努力应对气候变化和饮酒量下降的同时，斯堪的纳维亚国家的国产葡萄酒销量却在激增。【原文：

As traditional wine regions grapple with climate change and a decline in drinking, sales of domestic produce are surging in the Scandinavian nation. 

】

item.title: 澳大利亚旗舰可再生能源项目因成本上升而陷入困境
item.description: 澳大利亚斥资数十亿美元将其最高山脉改造成巨型抽水蓄电池的计划面临新的障碍，原因是成本增加和未能实现生产目标。【原文：Australia’s multibillion-dollar plan to turn its tallest mountain range into a giant pumped-hydro battery faces new roadblocks due to mounting costs and missed productivity targets.】

item.title: 顶级集装箱航运公司远离北极，中国寻找北极捷径
item.description: 中国最近对 "北方航道"（Northern Sea Route）的尝试，即利用俄罗斯和北极之间的航道运输货物，让世界上一些最大的集装箱承运商重申，北极对他们来说仍然不安全、不环保，也不具备商业可行性。【原文：China’s latest foray into the Northern Sea Route — using the channel between Russia and the North Pole to ship goods — has led some of the world’s largest container carriers to reiterate that the Arctic for them is still not safe, environmentally friendly or commercially viable.】

item.title: 燃气轮机短缺迫使企业重回煤炭行业
item.description:
人工智能推动的蓬勃发展的电力需求正在造成全球燃气轮机的短缺，斯蒂芬-斯塔普钦斯基（Stephen Stapczynski）和阿克沙特-拉蒂（Akshat Rathi）在《零点播客》中解释了其中的原因。【原文：

Booming electricity demand driven by AI is causing a shortage of gas turbines worldwide, Stephen Stapczynski and Akshat Rathi explain why on Zero podcast.

】

item.title: 台风 "麦德姆 "在袭击菲律宾时加强，正向中国移动
item.description: 台风 "麦德姆 "周五在菲律宾北部登陆时强度加大，预计将在那里降下暴雨。【原文：Typhoon Matmo intensified as it made landfall in northern Philippines on Friday where it’s forecast to dump heavy rain, with the nation still reeling from the impact of two deadly typhoons in the past two weeks.】

item.title: 日本推迟近海风电定价竞标，绿色推动受挫
item.description: 在对投资环境进行审查之前，日本无限期推迟了为海上风电项目设定政府资助水平的拍卖，这是日本推动扩大可再生能源供应的最新一击。【原文：Japan has delayed indefinitely an auction to set government funding levels for offshore wind projects pending a review of the investment climate, the latest blow to the country’s push to expand renewable energy supplies.】

item.title: <strong>少吃肉仍是旗舰饮食报告传达的信息</strong
item.description:
作者说，植物性饮食可以拯救数百万人的生命并减少农场排放，而这正是肉类行业一直在竭力削弱的。【原文：

The authors say plant-heavy diets could save millions of lives and cut farm emissions, claims the meat industry has sought to undermine.

】

item.title: 灾难与怪异科学：迪拜上空的风云究竟发生了什么？
item.description:
2024年的暴雨淹没了这座城市，造成至少4人死亡，并引发了有关阿联酋云播种计划的新问题。【原文：

Torrential rain flooded the city in 2024, killing at least four people and raising new questions about the UAE’s cloud seeding program.

】

item.title: 微软扩大与日本 Shizen Energy 的清洁能源交易
item.description: 微软公司与日本 Shizen Energy 公司签署了一批新的可再生能源协议，这是一家全球技术公司为确保清洁电力供应所做的最新努力。【原文：Microsoft Corp. has signed a new batch of renewable energy deals with Japan-based Shizen Energy Inc., the latest effort by a global technology company to secure clean electricity.】

item.title: 铀浓缩公司获美国批准生产更强核燃料
item.description: 美国唯一一家常规反应堆核燃料供应商铀浓缩公司（Urenco USA）已获得监管机构的许可，可以生产一种新型铀燃料。【原文：Urenco USA, the only US supplier of nuclear fuel for conventional reactors, has received permission from regulators to make a new type of uranium fuel.】

item.title: 酷暑导致西班牙死亡人数上升 87
item.description: 根据西班牙卫生部的数据，由于极端炎热的天气变得越来越致命，西班牙炎热的夏季导致今年死亡人数增加了 3800 多人。【原文：Spain’s scorching summer resulted in more than 3,800 additional deaths this year as extreme heat becomes increasingly deadly, according to the country’s health ministry.】

item.title: 德意志银行ESG高管在高层重组中离职
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）负责固定收益的环境、社会和公司治理以及可持续融资的全球主管即将离职，该银行将设立一个新的职位，负责更广泛的业务。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG’s global head of ESG and sustainable finance for fixed income is leaving the bank, as the lender creates a new role with a broader focus.】
